Natural Origin Ings. ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔ ✔

Is this cream non-comedogenic? Yes, it is non-comedogenic, no need to worry about that! How long can the Lait-Crème Concentré be stored? You can store it for 12 months after opening. You will also find the expiration date of your product indicated on the box and the tube. Is the Lait Crème Concentré also a make-up base? The Lait-Crème Concentré can indeed be used as a makeup base. This use has been tested, and 100% of women confirm that it is a good makeup base. Why is the tube made of aluminum instead of plastic? Our packaging prioritizes aluminum for several reasons. It is lightweight, durable, and provides the best protection against formula oxidation. It also allows for easy product dispensing right down to the last drop. Can I use it with a Serum? Yes, absolutely. Depending on your skin's needs, you can choose one of our serums. Dehydrated skin? We recommend Hydra-Serum. Lacking radiance? You need Radiant Complexion Serum. Need an anti-aging serum? Invest in Complete Serum.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really unique moisturizer
reviews.reviewText: LOVE this! (For context, I'm 61 with really good but very sensitive skin.) With ingredients like Soy Proteins, Aloe Vera, Beeswax, and Shea Butter, I worried that this might feel too waxy or thick. It's not. It's a unique moist-creamy texture that spreads out thinner than expected. It's nothing like the German Nivea I've been using (and loving) but almost like a cross between a lotion and a cream. It's different from any moisturizer that I've ever used. (I included a lot of photos for folks like me who are picky about product details.)When I applied just a little of this to my hand to test the texture, it immediately made the skin feel super-hydrated. About half a minute after I applied it to my face, I did feel a very slight tingle that wasn't irritating and didn't last longer than about 5 minutes. My skin felt hydrated and more supple than before I applied the cream. (I have one elbow that is very rough because I always lean on it when writing! One way that I test how moisturizing a face product is, I apply it to the elbow. By that test, this cream rocks! LOL)I haven't been wearing makeup since the lockdown started but I can tell that this would not affect a foundation at all. It just soaks into the skin and does its job. It's like it disappears but leaves my skin feeling really, really good.By the way, it really does only take a VERY tiny bit to treat the face and neck. I literally just touch the top of the tube and pat the cream around before smoothing it in. It blends into the skin quickly because of the unusual texture. You can see from the photo - no makeup, just lip gloss - that there is zero shine/oiliness to my skin. For most products, I have to let them "soak in" for a while. This one just works right away, no waiting for the shine to dissipate.I didn't realize until I got this that it's multi-use: moisturizer, makeup base, mask, makeup remover, milk, and body lotion. Since this is a primary moisturizer for me, I didn't really notice much difference in using more than 2 applications on my face on these very dry winter days. In the summer, one application will probably be fine. I also like using it on my wrists as a perfume primer.This is probably the 4th or 5th moisturizer that I have raved about in as many months but I think I've found my perfect fit. I was using Moistfull (until the formula changed), German Nivea (still do as a night cream), Age Perfect (my skin's outgrown it), and a Hyaluronic face & body lotion that I loved until it started drying/irritating my skin after 5 or 6 uses, and a homemade goat milk-glycerin lotion (still use for less dry weather). This is the first one that I have zero complaints about - including the price.About...- The packaging - There is an expiration date on both tube and container (small embossed on the tube & underside of the box by the UPC). The tube dispenser is metal-sealed. You use the cap to puncture the seal. The cream doesn't ooze out if you are careful. It's possible to just touch the tip of the tube to get enough cream without having to squeeze hard. The box and tube both have detailed labeling on the ingredients.- The amount - This is not a really large (or small) tube and I wondered how often I should re-order. After using it for the first few days, I am going to start with an every-3-month subscription - yes, I am already subscribing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Found my moisturizer spirit-animal
reviews.reviewText: I Googled 'What moisturizer does Kim Kardashian use' and this popped up. It's on the internet so it must be true, right? Feeling unmoved and noncommittal to what was already on my vanity, and given the reasonable (to me) price point, I gave it a shot. I am just turned 50. Historically no major skin issues. It has been feeling dry for the last year or so. I used it once and I fell hard for this cream. I tried both this and the Embryoderme (with the brownish-red lettering). I didn't care for that one. It was fine, but the Lait-Creme Concentre has a softer, richer feel. But still light. It's quickly absorbed, leaving my skin smooth and ready for whatever follows (usually a little bronzer/powder/blush). Zero tacky or greasy residue. I live in south FL where humidity and perspiration are the norm. When I heat up, lots of other lotions I've tried kind of float back to the surface leaving an oil slick in my sweat. Not this one -- it seems to just sink in and deeply nourish. Its non-invasive, faintly sweet scent is slightly nostalgic somehow. Comforting but not at all overpowering. I haven't yet used it as a 'make-up remover milk,' like it says on the tube. But speaking of the packaging, I LOVE the aluminum tube -- it crimps together as you go so you can effortlessly get every last bit of the liquid gold out. I'm likely a lifer for this cream.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very feminine face cream, cute package
reviews.reviewText: When I put this on, I feel very feminine and it just feels like I’m taking care of my skin. The smell i would say is pretty, dainty. Not overpowering.. this cream i would say really does brighten and even my complexion, it softens the skin as well. I’ve noticed less breakouts with this, I use it in the morning and at night. I would def like to try the night time wrinkle cream they have as well. I’m thirty, but hello preventative is key here 💅 the brand being French does make me feel alil fancy, this would actually be my first French skincare product. I usually go for Korean skincare (which is still amazing btw). All in all I really like this product ! Would totally recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice, but too light for winter
reviews.reviewText: This moisturizer is affordable, easy to apply, and pleasant to smell. I especially like the squeeze tube, which feels more hygienic than a jar that I would have to dunk my my finger into. It does moisturize my skin, but I still have dry, flaky patches in the winter due to the cold, dry air. I will probably use this in the warmer months and find something thicker in the meantime.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have to say that I was a bit hesitant to purchase this cream as I’ve spent hundreds of dollars on other brands claiming to as good as a facelift! After one application I was sold! Super creamy but NOT greasy and absorbed quickly! It’s not only great for my face and hands but has also worked miracles for my dry cracked heels! Yes, the tube is small but will last a long time! It just takes a dab! I would highly recommend it to all my friends and family!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great face cream!
reviews.reviewText: This cream is awesome and versatile. I use it for a moisturizer and even sometimes a creamy cleanser. I have even put on my chapped lips at times. I don’t wear makeup, but it’s supposed to be a good primer under makeup too. For the price, I think it’s a great product to have in your makeup bag. Product arrived quickly and was in perfect condition! Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My friend told me about this and so glad I tried it out. I’m not one to buy expensive makeup so it’ll tend to wash off after a couple hours, but after using this as a base, my makeup loooks soooooo good and lasts forever. Literally eliminates any texture in my skin once I apply makeup. Some folks complain about the smell but honestly it’s not bad at all and they’re exaggerating it smells nice and fresh

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not Worth the Price
reviews.reviewText: I haven’t yet tried the product itself, however seeing the size of it alone, I know that it’s too much money for so little product. I bought the $17 one which is the smaller one, compared to the $29 one. For reference, the height of it is about the same as those 8 fl oz water bottles, the really small and short ones.
Es súper hidratante y es excelente como base para el maquillaje!
Es una muy buena base para aplicar el maquillaje.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be my holy grail facial cream
reviews.reviewText: The only cream that’s kept my skin moisturized and non flaky or peeling when using Retin A and I tried so many and also mixed many things together. The redness in my skin has calmed down and my pores looks smaller, I have super oily/acne prone skin. And it’s not that heavy or greasy it’s quite lightweight and absorbs fairly quickly, I only use it at night though. And the price is super decent. Just try it lol.
